workingOptions.question: Students
answer:
Each year we run our Summer Internship Programme üåû

You'll be able to find details here on our career site from March each year.
At the moment we don't offer work placements or a graduate program.  But some of our roles can be a great fit if you're new to the workforce.

workingOptions.question: International workers
answer: PiedPiper is a registered sponsor - so we're happy to offer visa support where we can.  But due to Home Office restrictions, we can't sponsor all roles.
We also offer our international hires help relocating.  It varies a bit by role and requirements, but usually we'll give you some cash to help cover your costs.

workingOptions.question: Leave benefits
answer:
You can find the annual leave you'll get in the job description.

And on top of that, after 4 years you'll get an extra 6 weeks paid time off. A little thanks for your hard work!
We're also proud to offer generous maternity and paternity leave.

workingOptions.question: Flexible working options
answer: We work hard to make our offices a hive of activity and collaboration.  So while we prefer you work there when you can, we're flexible in hours and location.
If you need something permanent - like working different hours, part-time or remotely - best to mention this to the recruitment team when they contact you.  We'll do our best to accommodate you.

afterApply.question: What to wear to an interview?
answer:
What you have to say is important to us - not what you're wearing.

So wear whatever makes you comfortable and confident!

afterApply.question: How to prepare for interviews?
answer: In interviews, we want to get to know you.  Your previous positions and challenges.  And what you're looking for in a career.
So it's a good idea to have some examples of different challenges you've faced.  And be able to explain what action you took.  And how it all turned out.
It's also good to check out PiedPiper beforehand and get to know us and our industry.  And we'll have copies of your CV or portfolio - so no need to bring them.

afterApply.question: Do you keep applications for future jobs?
answer: The good news - we keep all applications for future roles.
The bad news - our system isn't always great at matching people to the right roles.
To be safe, check back here. And if there are no jobs I can let you know every time we have a new one.

afterApply.question: What happens after I apply?
answer: If you look like a good fit for the job, we'll get in touch to arrange a call.
After this, you'll be asked to complete a task for some roles.  There are no right or wrong answers to these - we just want to see how you solve real world problems.
Then you'll come in for an interview at our office.  We'll give you all the specific details based on the job you applied for.

prepareApplication.question: Reapplying for the same job
answer: If you weren't successful you can always reapply for a job.

But so you know, we'll look to see how you've addressed the reason you didn't get the job before.

It's normal for this to take time - maybe 6 to 12 months.

prepareApplication.question: If you need a CS degree
answer:
You don't need a computer science degree to be an engineer at PiedPiper.

We're more interested in what you can do now.

prepareApplication.question: Cover letters
answer:
We thought about this one and realised that cover letters are a pain to write and not that helpful...

So you don't need one to apply üòÄ

prepareApplication.question: Preparing your CV
answer:
We want to hear about what you've achieved, your strengths and skills.

We also want to know how you can apply them to the job you're applying for.
‚òùÔ∏è And a tip - when talking about your past jobs focus on what you achieved. Not your duties.
You can make your CV as long or short as you like - just keep it relevant.  And it helps to have a summary on the first page.
